poem:
**Crater Reverie**

In the heart of Australia,  
Mars whispers secrets—  
where thin air and soil blend,  
a canvas of rocks,  
Apollo's forgotten rehearsal.  
Beneath the moon's eye,   
scorpions converse with thorns,  
both poised,  
as shadows expand  
across alien terrains,  
echoes of a cosmic ballet  
waiting for a script.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Deep impact: touring central Australia’s cosmic craters “You didn’t mention camping on Mars.” My wife had a point: thin air, thinner soil, extreme UV, rocks straight from a Nasa red-planet image, jagged ranges – all ideal backdrops for a movie set. No wonder the place was considered for training by the Apollo program. Its sparse life forms include an intimidating shrub whose thorns mimic the stingers on the scorpions that come out after dark. A". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Deep impact: touring central Australia’s cosmic craters “You didn’t mention camping on Mars.” My wife had a point: thin air, thinner soil, extreme UV, rocks straight from a Nasa red-planet image, jagged ranges – all ideal backdrops for a movie set. No wonder the place was considered for training by the Apollo program. Its sparse life forms include an intimidating shrub whose thorns mimic the stingers on the scorpions that come out after dark. A
